channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 2 Laurel Trees blocking visibility at junction, 29th December
item.description:
Please cut down the 2 large Laurel trees at the Junction of Amber Road and Sapphire Road in Bishops Cleeve. They are severely restricting visibility at the junction and should not have been planted there in the first place by the builders of the new housing estate.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Amber Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding in rain, 29th December
item.description:
Lits of water making it impossible for pedestrians and cyclists when car passing.Happens whenever much rain Both sides of main road and both sides og ju cation Naunton Lane .Worse south side

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thirlestaine Road, Tivoli, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep pothole in the middle of the carriageway, 29th December
item.description:
Windyridge road, Cheltenham. Travelling from Swindon lane towards Swindon road, about 3m after the Red Rower close junction, in-line with the first sapling/tree is a pothole in the left hand side of the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Windyridge Road, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham

item.title: Small footbridge would help cross small stream, 29th December
item.description:

item.title: Path impassable due to holding recent rain, 29th December
item.description:
The curve in the path act like a 'bowl'. It is impassable due to holding the rain water. Needs filling and levelling out on this small stretch of pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Up Hatherley Way, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Drop kerb damaged by Plane tree roots/road markings badly worn leading to parking over entrance to 7 properties., 29th December
item.description:
On going through the traffic lights at the Hales Road/Old Bath road heading into town the location is about 50 yards on the left just past the bus shelter. There is a private driveway leading to 7 properties. I personally dragged most of the filthy wet mass of fallen leaves away myself to reveal what is left of the double yellow lines. Not only does it require the road markings to be refreshed but the addition of a "Keep Clear" would help enormously.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Old Bath Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Dead tree fallen against my rear fence, 29th December
item.description:
Land at the back of 5 Otter road Abbeymead. Dead tree has fallen and now against my rear fence.with potential to cause damage. Trees either side could also suffer the same fate and need cutting back as they too will cause unnecessary damage to my property. Have requested numerous times for work to be done on the trees but falls on deaf ears each time but now needs sorting asap
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Otter Road, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Ash Tree located on Highway land

item.title: Drain completely blocked, water pouring out and has been for a year now! I have tried to divert the water but it is hopeless and nobody seems to care. I have reported this numerous times the work sheet acknowledged then nothing done, 28th December
item.description:
Above markhuset , as you are driving up the hill with markhuset on the right the drain is on the left and it needs to be jet washed as I have explained many times to max Kelly, David Gray and the parish council who have also escalated this problem but yet again we are obviously very low on the job list!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gambles Lane, Woodmancote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lighting out, 28th December
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 32, Hazel Way, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Three 30 cm potholes on Cherry Avenue, 28th December
item.description:
A line of three potholes that have been getting steadily bigger over a period of two to three months. There is also some deep cracks emerging.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Ravensgate Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
